Such an excellent show.I read about how there was talk about replacing the narrator Mike Rowe and hiring some British narrator instead because Mike has demand for his talents.I dont know if I would watch it if he were gone.He really is the voice for the show.I get a bit tired of always hearing a British accent every time I watch a documentary.It would also be nice to see some fresh faces as well.You always see all the same scientist on these shows from The Universe onto How the Universe Works.Seems like they just keep recycling them.Case in point Michio Kaku-He is everywhere on every show now and on the news.I swear he has a clone or two walking around doing his bidding.Of course if they had (full blown hotty)-Dr.Amy Menzer  on I doubt I would be complaining to much.Anyone know if there will be a season 2 ?I haven't been able to find any info on that anywhere Ive searched.

I revisited (watched) some of these episodes myself the other day and realized the audio for episode 5 (Supernovas) is slightly out of sync. Not that it matters too much as most of the program is computer graphics and voice-over, but it jumped out at me bugged me no end. I do recall wondering about the sync for that episode at one stage.... I think I just watched them enough to not be able to tell any more. Anyway.....

If you're fussy like me and want to fix it, download and install MKVtoolnix. It's free and handy to have on hand for fixing MKV files anyway. Just open the episode with MKVMergeGUI (part of MKVtoolnix), select the AC3 audio track and then the "Format Specific Options" tab. Type 120 in the delay box (I'm fairly sure the audio needs to be delayed by 120ms or therabouts), then hit the "Start Muxing" button. You'll have a new copy with the audio in sync as fast as your hard drive can write the new file.

Sorry about that.

http://www.bunkus.org/videotools/mkvtoolnix/downloads.html
Windows version is near the bottom of the page.
